posts.message:
http://Notedn.com
==========
I built Notedn.com two years ago

i built it for personal usage at first , then i developed it to be a public online service

it was takefastnotes.com at the beginning, it was in arabic and english interfaces and for notes only

a year ago i developed it to a new only english version , added (Taskbook) feature and planned for two more features ( codebook ) & ( linkbook ) , but i never had time to do them ,

do you have any advices about the site because i think about taking it down :(
posts.caption: notedn.com
posts.description: Notedn is an online notes manager and a cloud service that makes it easy for you to save your notes, links, codes and create to-do lists. It makes them reachable anywhere anytime. You can use reminders and categories to remember your notes and organize them. You also can use to-do lists to organize…

posts.message:
There has been internal conflict between Debian developers, appears to be between those who support freedom of choice even at the cost of some advantages, and those who support better performance and usability at the cost of bloated system that is difficult to modify freely (what is referred to as "lock-in" in the article). The bloat comes from adopting systemd instead of sysvinit, apparently. Debian is significant because it is one of the most widely-spread distributions and the base of many other distributions, such as Ubuntu and Linux Mint.

After lots of mediation efforts failed, Debian is finally going to be forked. The freedom-supporting fork will be called Devuan.

Although this is not about technical aspects, it is about policy, and about the philosophy of free software and the role of civil society in protecting ideals.

posts.message:
Hi Geeks, i want to ask u about something but i don't know if it is violates the posting roles; if it is , feel free to remove it ;)

I was asked to develop an app for a clinic, obviously this is supposed to be a small project. I am a web developer but due to the project size i considered Java Swing, as it is easy to install and doesn't require an application server to run it. 

due to your experience, is this a good decision. java swing with old JDBC is fine with small apps ?

My first Cordova Android App :
https://github.com/khashabawy/company-checker

It is easy using html5, CSS and JS
posts.caption: github.com
posts.description: company-checker - Simple android application to check for latest Company script versions
